But I'm gonna be there... for the rest of my life. I mean, I can't break up with him. I'm the one who made him quit drinking. He's dull because of me.
Alright, don't say that. He's probably always been dull. You just, you know, set it free.

scene: Ross, Phoebe, Rachel, and Chandler at Monica and Rachel's apartment discussing Joey and other topics
difficulty_description: 此场景包含一些复杂句型和幽默对话，对话内容较长，适合中级学习者。

dialogues.text: Did Joey say what he was gonna do when he left?
No, I don't even think he knew. Hey, would you sleep with somebody to get a great job?
I don't know. Who would I have to sleep with?
Me.
Why would I have to sleep with you?
It's my game. You want the job or not?

scene: Monica enters the room and discusses weekend plans and Bobby's drinking
difficulty_description: 此场景涉及日常生活用语，同时还包含一些幽默和感情表达，适合中级学习者。

dialogues.text: Hey.
Morning.
Where ya goin'?
Bobby and I are going away for the weekend, remember?
Ooooohhhh.
What's with all the bottles of liquor?
What's going on, is... uh, Bobby drinking again?
Oh no no, this is not for him, this is for me. That way he's still sober but I find his stories about shoelaces much more amusing.

scene: Fun Bobby talks to Monica in the hall and breaks up with her
difficulty_description: 此场景包含涉及情感讨论和复杂表达，适合高级学习者。

dialogues.text: Uh, can I talk to you a minute?
Sure.
This is really hard for me to say.
Oh God, you fell off the wagon.
Oh, no, no, it's about you.
What about me?
I think you may have a drinking problem.
What these? Oh, these are, um, for.. cuts and scrapes.
Look, I am just not strong enough to be in a codependent relationship right now, OK?
Oh... shoot.
Well, anyway, I hope we can be friends.
OK.

scene: Monica returns to the apartment and breaks the news about the breakup
difficulty_description: 此场景含有多人的互动对话，需理解情感表达，适合中级学习者。

dialogues.text: What happened?
Well we... we kinda broke up.
Awwwwwwww.
Does anybody want these?
I'll take one. Sometimes I like to hold stuff like this and pretend I'm a giant.
Hey.
Hey!
How'd the callback go?
It was unbelievable! I walked in there and she was all over me.
So what'd you do?
Well, I couldn't do it. I told her I didn't want to get the part that way.
Good for you.
But wait, wait, wait. Then, after I left her office, she caught up with me at the elevator and offered me an even bigger part.
So... and?
Soooooo... you are now looking at Dr. Drake Ramore, neurosurgeon, recurring in at least four episodes!
Allright!
Alright... I've got to go shower.

scene: Russ enters Central Perk and discusses his breakup with Chandler and Phoebe
difficulty_description: 此场景涉及轻松的幽默对话和简单的情感表达，适合中级学习者。

dialogues.text: Hi.
Oh, hey.
Hi.
I guess you guys heard, Rachel dumped me.
Yeah, I'm sorry man.
Oh, all she said was that I remind her too much of somebody. You have any idea who she's talking about?
Oh I do, it's.... it's Bob Saget. She hates him.
Oh.

scene: Julie enters Central Perk and discusses her feelings about Ross with Chandler, Phoebe, and Russ
difficulty_description: 此场景包含情感交互和简单的问答对话，适合中级学习者。

dialogues.text: Hey.
Hey!
Hey, Julie! Hey, how are you doing?
Um, oh, I don't know. I mean, it's definitely weird not being with Ross, but I guess I'm doing OK. Actually I've got some of his stuff that he, um....

scene: Monica 和朋友们在 Monica 和 Rachel 的公寓里照看 Ben
difficulty_description: 包含多种情感和角色互动，对话内容较长，适合具有一定英语基础的学习者。

dialogues.text: Who da wenny-Benny boy? You the Wenny-wenny-Benny-Benny boy, yes. (Ben starts crying.) Don't cry. Don't cry. (To Ross) Why is he still crying?
Let me hold him for a sec. There. (Ben stops crying) Huh? There we are.
Maybe it's me.
Don't be silly. Ben loves you. He's just being Mr. Crankypants.
You know, I once dated a Miss Crankypants. Lovely girl, kinda moody.
There we go. All better. (gives Ben back to Monica)
There's my little boy. (Ben starts crying again)
Can I uh see something? (Takes Ben. When he puts him close to Monica, Ben cries. When he moves Ben away, he stops crying. He does that a couple times.)
Cool.
He hates me. My nephew hates me.
Come on, don't do this.
What if my own baby hates me? Huh? What am I gonna do then?

Monica, will you stop? This is nuts. Do you know how long it's gonna be before you actually have to deal with this problem? I mean, you don't even have a boyfriend yet. (Monica glares at him.) Joey, she does not look fat.

scene: Monica 在她和 Rachel 的公寓里和 Chandler、Joey 和 Ross 继续互动，Ross 发现自己对 kiwi 过敏
difficulty_description: 包含复杂句型和幽默元素，适合中级英语学习者。

dialogues.text: (to Chandler) Here you go. (Sets a drink down in front of him.)
Oh hey Monica. (He holds the basketball in front of Monica.)
(imitating Ben) Waah!! (Chandler moves the basketball away) Goo, goo, goo. (Chandler moves the basketball in front of Monica again.) Waaah!
That is so funny. Let me see that a sec. (She throws the ball out the window)
(starts to make some gurgling sounds)
Are you ok, Ross?
I don't know. What's in this pie?
Uh, I don't know, butter, eggs, flour, lime, kiwi...
Kiwi? Kiwi? You said it was a key lime pie.
No I didn't, I said kiwi lime. That's what makes it so special.
And that's what's gonna kill me. I'm allergic to kiwi.
No you're not. You're, you're allergic to lobster and peanuts and...
Ugh.
Oh my god.
Ugh. It's definitely getting worse.
Is your tongue swelling up?
Either that or my mouth is getting smaller.
All right, get your coat, we're gonna go to the hospital.
Is he gonna be ok?
Yeah, he's just gotta get a shot.
(sitting back down) You know, you know, actually it's getting better. It is. It is. Let's not go. Anyone for Thcrabble?
Jacket now.
What about Ben? We can't bring a baby to a hospital.
We'll watch him.
I don't think tho.
What? I have seven Catholic sisters. I've taken care of hundreds of kids. Come on, we wanna do it, don't we?
Well, I was looking forward to playing basketball, but I guess that's out the window.
Ok, well, if you do take him out for his walk, you might wanna bring his hat, and there's extra milk in the fridge, and there's extra diapers in the bag.
Hat, milk, got it.
??? (speech garbled) Thro up a thro thro—a thro thro!
Consider it done.
You understood that?
Yeah, my uncle Sal has a really big tongue.
Is he the one with the beautiful wife?

scene: Central Perk，Rachel 遇见 Phoebe 并解释 Phoebe 被替换的问题
difficulty_description: 场景主要集中在 Rachel 与 Phoebe 和 Terry 的对话，涉及复杂的委婉表达和解释语境，适合中级英语学习者。

dialogues.text: Hey Rach, wanna hear the new song I'm thinkin' of singing this afternoon? I wrote it this morning in the shower.
Ok.
(singing) I'm in the shower and I'm writing a song. Stop me if you've heard it. My skin is soapy, and my hair is wet, and Tegrin spelled backward is Nirget.
Uh, Rachel, sweetheart, could I see ya for a minute?
What's up?
F.Y.I.. I've decided to pay a professional musician to play in here on Sunday afternoons. Her name is Stephanie... something. She's supposed to be very good.
But what about Phoebe?
Rachel, it's not that your friend is bad, it's that she's so bad, she makes me want to put my finger through my eye into my brain and swirl it around.
Ok, ok, so you're not a fan, but I mean, come on, you cannot do this to her.
Uh... (Points at Rachel.)
Oh, no no no no. Oh no no no no. I have to do this to her?

scene: Chandler 和 Joey 带着 Ben 在街上试图吸引女性的注意
difficulty_description: 对话涉及多人物的幽默互动，适合有一定英语基础且理解文化背景的学习者。

dialogues.text: You know, I don't think we brought enough stuff. Did you forget to pack the baby's anvil?

It's gonna be worth it. It's a known fact that women love babies, all right? Women love guys who love babies. It's that whole sensitive thing. Quick, aim him at that pack o' babes over there. Maybe one of them will break away. No, no wait, forget them, we got one, hard left. All right, gimme the baby.
No, I got him.
No, seriously.
Oh, seriously you want him?
Hello.
Hello.
And who is this little cutie pie?
Well, don't, don't think me immodest, but, me?
You wanna smell him?
I assume we're talking about the baby now.
Oh, yeah. He's got that great baby smell. Get a whiff of his head.
(She smells his head.) I think my uterus just skipped a beat.
(to Chandler) What'd I tell you? What'd I tell you?
I think it's great you guys are doing this.
Well, we are great guys.
You know, my brother and his boyfriend have been trying to adopt for three years. What agency did you two go through?

scene: Central Perk，Phoebe 和 Rachel 再次讨论 Phoebe 被替换的问题
difficulty_description: 对话较长，涉及情感冲突和委婉表达，适合有一定英语基础的学习者。

dialogues.text: Honey, I'm sorry.
And he's going to be paying this woman? Why doesn't he just give her like a throne, and a crown, and like a, you know, gold stick with a ball on top.
Terry is a jerk, ok? That's why we're always saying "Terry's a jerk!" That's where that came from.
Yeah, ok. You probably did everything you could.

Ok, you know what, lemme, let me just see what else I can do. (She goes over to Terry.) All right, look, look. Why don't you just let her go on after Stephanie whatever-her-name-is. I mean, you won't even be here. You don't pay her. It's not gonna cost you anything.
I, I don't know.
Come on, Terry, I'll even clean the cappuccino machine.
You don't clean the cappuccino machine?
Of course I clean it. I mean, I,I will cleeeean it. I mean, I will cleeeean it.
Oh, all right, fine, fine, fine.
(She goes back to Phoebe.) Done.
Really?
Yeah. Who's workin' for you babe?
Oh! Oh my god. This is so exciting. How much am I gonna get?
What?
Well you said that he's paying the people who are playing.
Oh, no, no no. I meant that he's gonna be paying that other woman because she's a professional.
Well, I'm not gonna be the only one who's not getting paid.
Well, but Pheebs...
No, huh uh, I'm sorry, no. No, I'm not some like sloppy second, charity band. You know what, there are thousands of places in this city where people would be happy to pay to hear me play.

scene: Central Perk 外, Phoebe 在人行道上唱歌
difficulty_description: 简单的歌词样式，自言自语，适合初级学习者。

dialogues.text: (singing, angrily) When I play, I play for me, I don't need your charity. (Someone puts a coin in her guitar case) Thank you! La la la la la la la....

scene: Ross 在医院因为对针头的恐惧感到紧张，Monica 尝试安抚他。
difficulty_description: 包含对恐惧的讨论，句子中等长度，适合有一定英语基础的学习者。

dialogues.text: Well, there's no way I'm gonna get a shot. Maybe they can take the needle and thquirt it into my mouth, you know, like a thquirt gun.
Hello, there. I'm Dr. Carlin. I see someone's having an allergic reaction.
Doctor, can I see you for just a minute please? My brother has a slight phobia about needles.
Did you tell him about my thquirt gun idea?
My brother, the PhD would like to know if there's any way to treat this orally.
No, under these circumstances it has to be an injection, and it has to be now.
Tho?
That's good, have a seat. Um, the doctor says it's gotta be a needle. You're just gonna have to be brave, ok? Can you do that for me?
Ok.
Ok. Oh boy. You are doin' so good. You wanna squeeze my hand?
Yes!
Okay.  Alright, Ross, don't squeeze it so hard. Honey, really, don't squeeze it so hard!
Ohhh.

scene: Chandler 和 Joey 在街头带 Ben 寻找机会搭讪。
difficulty_description: 对话涉及幽默和打趣，适合具有一定英语基础并理解美国文化的学习者。

dialogues.text: That's a good plan, Joe. Next time we wanna pick up women, we should just go to the park and make out. Taxi, taxi!
Hey, hey, look at that talent.
Just practicing. You're good. Carry on.
Wait-wait-wait-wait!
Wait!  Wait!

scene: Chandler 和 Joey 在巴士上试图搭讪两个女孩，Ben 却被遗忘在巴士上。
difficulty_description: 情节诙谐幽默，句子长度适中，适合中等基础的学生。

dialogues.text: Hey, you. He's just adorable.
Ok, but can you tell him that, because he thinks he's too pink.
So what are you guys out doing today?
Oh we're not out. No, no. We're just uh, two heterosexual guys, hanging with the son of our other heterosexual friend, doin' the usual straight guy stuff.
You done?
Yeah.
Oh, there's our stop.
Get outta here. This is our stop too.
You guys live around here too?
Oh, yeah, yeah, sure. We live in the building by the uh sidewalk.
You know it?
Hey, look, since we're neighbors and all, what do you say we uh, get together for a drink?
So uh, you wanna go to Marquel's?
Oh, sure, they love us over there.
Where's your baby?
Ben! Ben! Ben!

scene: Chandler 和 Joey 追赶巴士，试图找回 Ben。
difficulty_description: 对话短小精悍，情节直接，适合英语初学者。

dialogues.text: Ben!
Oh, that's good. Maybe he'll hear you and pull the cord.
Stop the bus! Wait! Wait! Wait!

scene: Monica 和 Ross 在医院，Monica 的手受伤了。
difficulty_description: 对话包含医学专业术语和误会，适合中级学习者。

dialogues.text: Are you sure he didn't break it because it really hurts?
No, it's just a good bone bruise. And, right here is the puncture wound from your ring.
Oh, I'm sorry, I'm really sorry. Sorry. Sorry! Hey! Hey! I got my s's back! Which we can celebrate later. Celebrate.

scene: Phoebe 在 Central Perk 外唱歌，遇到新来的吉他手 Stephanie。
difficulty_description: 对话简单直接，适合初级到中等基础的学习者。

dialogues.text: Hey. So um, are you the professional guitar player?
Yeah. I'm Stephanie.
Right. My name was on there, but now it just says 'carrot cake'. So, um, so um, how many chords do you know?
All of them.
Oh yeah, so you know D?
Yeah.
Ok, do you know A minor?
Yeah.
Ok, do you know how to go from D to A minor?
Yeah.
Ok. Um, so does your guitar have a strap?
No.
Oh. Mine does. Stephanie knows all the chords.

scene: Chandler 和 Joey 在电话亭联系交通局找 Ben。
difficulty_description: 对话涉及笑话和急切的情感，适合有一定基础的学习者。

dialogues.text: (on pay phone) Come on, pick up, pick up! Hello? Transit Authority? Yes, hello. I'm doing research for a book, and I was wondering what someone might do if they left a baby on a city bus.
Hi, here's the deal. We lost a carseat on a bus today. It's white plastic, with a handle, and it fits onto a stroller. Oh, and there was a baby in it. He wants to talk to you again.

scene: Rachel 在 Central Perk 介绍 Stephanie 表演。
difficulty_description: 适合具有一定英语基础的学习者，包含幽默元素。

dialogues.text: Ok, everybody, let's give a uh nice warm Central Perk welcome to...
Terry's a jerk, and he won't let me work, and I hate Central Perk!
Uh, to Stephanie Schiffer.
Thank you. I'd like to start with a song that I wrote for the first man I ever loved. Zachary.
You're all invited to bite me!

scene: Chandler 和 Joey 在纽约市公共卫生服务部门找回 Ben。
difficulty_description: 对话包括幽默和急切的情感，适合中等水平的学习者。

dialogues.text: Hi. We're the guys who called about the baby. We left the baby on this bus. Is he here? Is he here?
He's here. I'm assuming one of you is the father.
That's me.
I'm him.
Actually, uh, we're both the father.
Oh, Ben! Hey, buddy!
Please tell me you know which one is our baby.
Well, well that one has ducks on his t-shirt, and this one has clowns. And Ben was definitely wearing ducks.
Ok.
Or clowns.
Hey, Ben, remember us? Ok, the mole came off.
Ahh!
What're we gonna do? What're we gonna do?
Uh, we'll flip for it. Ducks or clowns.
Oh, we're gonna flip for the baby?
You got a better idea?
Alright, call it in the air.
Heads.
Heads it is.
Yes! Whew!
We have to assign heads to something.
Right. Ok, ducks is heads, because ducks have heads.
What kind of scary-ass clowns came to your birthday?

scene: Rachel 与 Phoebe 在 Central Perk 门外交谈。
difficulty_description: 内容涉及情感支持和理解，适合具备一定英语基础的学习者。

dialogues.text: Here. I thought you might be cold.
Thank you.
Whoa, look at you, you did pretty well.
Eight dollars and 27 cents. But not really, 'cause I put in the first two, just to, you know, get the ball rolling, and to make myself feel better.
Do you?

No. This whole like playing-for-money thing is so not good for me. You know, I don't know, when I sang 'Su-Su-Suicide,' I got a dollar seventy-five. But then, 'Smelly Cat,' I got 25 cents and a condom. So you know, now I just feel really bad for Smelly Cat.
Well, you know, honey, I don't think everybody gets Smelly Cat. You know, I mean, if all you've ever actually had are healthy pets, then, whoosh!
It's not even that. I used to do my songs because it made me happy, but now it's like, it's just all about the money.
Well, people missed you in there. And in fact, there was actually a request for 'Smelly Cat.'
Really? From who?
Well, from me. And I know it's not your big money song, but it's my favorite.
Hi. Uh, did I accidentally drop a condom in your case? It's kind of an emergency.
Yeah. Here you go.
Thanks a lot. Hey Christine, I got it!

scene: Monica 和朋友们在公寓里见到 Carol 和 Susan 给 gang 看 Ben
difficulty_description: 此场景包含较长句型和一些幽默表达，对话词汇相对复杂，适合中级学习者。

dialogues.text: Ok, these were unbelievably expensive, and I know he's gonna grow out of them in like, 20 minutes, but I couldn't resist.
Oh, look at these! Hey, Ben. Just do it. Oh my God, oh, ok, was that too much pressure for him?
Oh, is he hungry already?
I guess so.
You know, it's... something funny about sneakers. I'll be right back.
I gotta get one, too.

scene: Chandler 和 Joey 逃到厨房，Ross 跟随
difficulty_description: 对话内容涉及讨论一个较为敏感的话题，且句型较复杂，适合中级学习者。

dialogues.text: What are you guys doing?
We're just hanging out by the spoons. Ladle?
Look, would you guys grow up? That is the most natural beautiful thing in the world.
Yeah, we know, but there's a baby suckin' on it.

This is my son having lunch, ok? It's gonna happen a lot, so you'd better get used to it. Now if you have any problem with it, if you're uncomfortable, just ask questions. Carol's fine with it, now come on.

scene: 大家重新回到客厅，Ross 鼓励大家问 Carol 关于母乳喂养的问题
difficulty_description: 对话较短，对母乳喂养的话题提出了一些基本问题，适合初级学习者。

dialogues.text: Carol?
Carol? I was just wondering if Joey could ask you a question about breast-feeding?
Sure.
Uh, does it hurt?
It did at first, but not anymore.
Chandler?
So, uh, how often can you do it?
As much as he needs.
Ok, I got one, I got one. Uh, if he blows into one, does the other one get bigger?

scene: Central Perk，Julie 和大家讨论折扣购物
difficulty_description: 包含一些复杂句型和文化相关的内容，适合中级学习者。

dialogues.text: Rachel, do you have any muffins left?
Yeah, I forget which ones.
Oh, you're busy, that's ok, I'll get it. Anybody else want one?
No thanks.
Oh, you're losin' your apron here, let me get it. There you go.
Thank you.
What a bitch.
Oh, listen you guys.
I have this friend at Bloomingdale's who's quitting tomorrow, and he wants to abuse his discount. So, anyone want to come with me and take advantage of it?
I can't, I have to take my grandmother to the vet.
Ok, um, I'll go with you.
Great.
Hi, honey.
Hey, sweetums.
Hello to the rest.
Hi!
Monica what're you doin'? You can't go shopping with her? What about Rachel?
It's gonna be a problem, isn't it?
Come on, you're going to Bloomingdale's with Julie? That's like cheating on Rachel in her house of worship.
But I'm...
Monica, she will kill you. She will kill you like a dog in the street.
So, uh, Jules tells me you guys are going shopping tomorrow?
Yeah, uh, it's actually not that big a deal.
It's a big deal to me. This is great, Monica. I really appreciate this.
You're welcome.
Woof, woof.

scene: 百货商店里，Joey 在销售男士香水
difficulty_description: 对话较短，内容直接，适合初级学习者。

dialogues.text: (A guy walks by) Bijan for men?
(Another guy walks by) Bijan for men?
(Another guy walks by) Bijan for men?
(An attractive woman walks by.) Hey Annabelle.
Hey, Joey. So did you hear about the new guy?
Who?
Nobody knows his name. Me and the girls just call him the Hombre man.
What's he doin' in my section?
I guess he doesn't know.
Well, he's gonna.
Hey, how ya doin'?
Mornin'.
Listen, I know you're new, but it's kinda understood that everything from Young Men's to the escalator is my territory.
Your territory, huh?
Yeah. Bijan for men?
No thanks.
Hombre?
Yeah. All right.
You were saying?

scene: Central Perk，Monica 和 Phoebe 讨论如何隐瞒购物事实
difficulty_description: 此场景对话较长且略带掩饰，词汇相对复杂，适合中级学习者。

dialogues.text: Phoebe, listen. You were with me, and we were shopping all day.
What?
We were shopping, and we had lunch.
Oh, all right. What did I have?
You had a salad.
Oh, no wonder I don't feel full.
Hey, guys, what's up.
I went shopping with Monica all day, and I had a salad.
Good, Pheebs. What'd you buy?
Um, we went shopping for um, for, fur.
You went shopping for fur?
Yes, and then I realized I'm against that, and uh, so then we bought some, uh, boobs.
You bought boobs?
Bras! We bought bras! We bought bras.

scene: Joey 试图追求 Annabelle
difficulty_description: 对话简短直接，理解压力小，适合初级学习者。

dialogues.text: Hey, Annabelle, Uh, listen, I was wondering if maybe after work you and I could go maybe grab a cup of coffee.
Oh, actually I sorta have plans.
Ready, Annabelle?
You bet. Maybe some other time?
Hey, it's not the first time I lost a girl to a cowboy spraying cologne. Bijan for men?
Bijan for men?!

scene: Monica 和 Rachel 在自己的公寓里和 Carol 谈话
difficulty_description: 讨论的主题虽然轻松，但涉及父母与孩子的相处细节和一些幽默表达，适合中级学习者。

dialogues.text: Ok, and this is Funny Clown. Funny Clown is only for after his naps, not before his naps or he won't sleep.
Carol, we've been through this before, ok? We have a good time. We laugh, we play. It's like we're father and son.
Honey, relax. Ross is great with him. Don't look so surprised. I'm a lovely person.
Oh, this is so cute.
Oh, I got that for him.
My mommies love me. That's clever.
Hello? Oh, Hi, Ju—Hi, Jew! Uh huh? Uh huh? Uh huh? Ok. Um, sure, that'd be great. See ya then. Bye.
Did you just say Hi, Jew?
Yes. Uh, yes, I did. That was my friend, Eddie Moskowitz. Yeah, he likes it. Reaffirms his faith.

scene: Monica 和 Rachel 在厨房准备 Ben 的晚餐
difficulty_description: 对话包含一些幽默表达和对母乳的讨论，语言稍显复杂，适合中级学习者。

dialogues.text: Ben, dinner!
Thanks Aunt Pheebs. Hey, you didn't microwave that, did you, because it's breast milk, and you're not supposed to do that.
Duh, I think I know how to heat breast milk. Ok.
What did you just do?
I licked my arm, what?
It's breast milk.
So?
Phoebe, that is juice, squeezed from a person.
What is the big deal?
What did you just do?
Ok, would people stop drinking the breast milk?
You won't even taste it?
No!
Not even if you just pretend that it's milk?
Not even if Carol's breast had a picture of a missing child on it.

scene: Monica enters Rachel's apartment, who just came out of her bedroom. They discuss Monica's lunch expense.
difficulty_description: 这个场景包含更复杂的句子结构和语法，适合有一定基础的英语学习者。

dialogues.text: Hey, where is everybody?
They took Ben to the park. Where've you been?
Just out. Had some lunch, just me, little quality time with me. Thanks for your jacket.
Oh, no problem. You can borrow it, by the way. Here are your keys, hon.
Okay.
Mon, if uh you were at lunch alone, how come it cost you uh 53 dollars?
You know what probably happened? Someone musta stolen my credit card.
And sorta just put the receipt back in your pocket?
That is an excellent excellent question. That is excellent.
Monica, what is with you? Who'd you have lunch with?
Judy.
Who?
Julie.
What?!
Jody!
You were with Julie?
Look, when it started I was just trying to be nice to her because she was my brother's girlfriend. And then, one thing led to another and, before I knew it, we were...shopping.
Oh. Oh my God.
Honey, wait. We only did it once. It didn't mean anything to me.
Yeah, right. Sure!
Really, Rachel, I was thinking of you the whole time. Look, I'm sorry, all right. I never meant for you to find out!
Oh, please, you wanted to get caught.
That is not true!
Oh, so you just sort of happened to leave it in here?
Did it ever occur to you that I might just be that stupid?
Ok, Monica. I just have to know one thing. Did you go with her to Bloomingdale's?
(looks away)
Oh! Ok, ok, ok, I just really, uh, I just really need to not be with you right now.

scene: Monica is on the phone in the apartment while Chandler and Ross are asleep. Carol and Susan arrive.
difficulty_description: 此场景为多人对话，包含一些复杂语句，但总体容易理解，适合中级学习者。

dialogues.text: Hi, who's this? Hi, Joanne. Is Rachel working? It's Monica. Yes, I know I did a horrible thing. Joanne, it's not as simple as all that, ok? No, I don't care what Steve thinks. Hi, Steve.
Hey!
Oh, I tasted Ben's milk, and Ross freaked out.
I did not freak out.
Why'd you freak out?
Because it's breast milk. It's gross.
My breast milk is gross?
This should be fun.
No, no, Carol. There's nothing wrong with it. I just, I just don't think breast milk is for adults.
Of course the packaging does appeal to grown-ups and kids alike.
Ross, you're being silly. I've tried it, it's no big deal. Just taste it.
(jumping away) That would be no.
Come on. It doesn't taste bad.
Yeah, it's kinda sweet, sorta like, uh...
Cantaloupe juice.
Exactly.
(staring at Susan) You've tasted it? You've tasted it.
Uh huh.
Oh, you've tasted it.
You can keep saying it, but it won't stop being true.
(he rolls up his sleeve) Gimme the bottle.
Gimme the towel.

scene: Joey enters Chandler's apartment dressed as a cowboy. They discuss Joey's new job.
difficulty_description: 对话句子较为口语化，适合具备一定口语基础的学习者。

dialogues.text: Howdy.
Gimme a box a juice. Well, they switched me over to Hombre.
Well, maybe it's because of the way you're dressed.
Or maybe it's because this guy's doing so good they wanna put more people on it. You should see this guy, Chandler, he goes through two bottles a day.
What do you care? You're an actor. This is your day job. This isn't supposed to mean anything to you.
I know, but, I was the best, you know? I liked being the best. I don't know. Maybe I should just get outta the game. They need guys up in housewares to serve cheese.
All right, say you do that. You know sooner or later somebody's gonna come along that slices a better cheddar. And then where're you gonna run?
Yeah I guess you're right.
You're damn right I'm right. I say you show this guy what you're made of. I say you stand your ground. I say you show him that you are the baddest hombre west of the lingerie.
I'm gonna do it.

scene: Rachel cleans up outside Central Perk while Monica tries to apologize for befriending Julie.
difficulty_description: 对话较为情绪化，包含深入的人际关系讨论难度较大，适合高级学习者。

dialogues.text: I don't know what else to say.
Well that works out good, because I'm not listening.
I feel terrible, I really do.
Oh, I'm sorry, did my back hurt your knife?
Rachel, say that I'm friends with her, we spend some time together. Is that so terrible?
Yes.
It's that terrible?
Yes. Monica, you don't get it. It's bad enough that she's stolen the guy who might actually be the person that I am supposed to be with, but now, she's actually stealing you.
Me? What are you talking about? Nobody could steal me from you. I mean, just because I'm friends with her doesn't make me any less friends with you. I mean, you're my...We're, we're...Oh, I love you.
I love you too.
You guys, um I know that this really doesn't have anything to do with me, but um I love you guys too.
I really think that if you gave her a chance, you'd like her. Would you just give that a chance, for me?
I'd do anything for you, you know that.
I'd do anything for you.
Wait, wait, wait, wait!

scene: Joey faces off with Hombre Man at the department store.
difficulty_description: 对话情境简单，有些戏剧效果，适合初级学习者。

dialogues.text: Mornin'.
I heard ya.
All right, everybody, I'm openin' the doors. You boys ready?
Ready.
Yeah, I'm ready.
You idiot, you stupid cowboy, you blinded me, I'm suing!
Oh my god, Todd! What the hell did you do?
I'm sorry. I am such a doofus. I'm so sorry, I'm so sorry.
My god, what happened?
These new kids, they never last. Sooner or later, they all...stop lastin'. Listen, uh, what do you say I buy you that cup of coffee now?
Sure.

scene: Rachel brings a muffin to Chandler and Monica at Central Perk
difficulty_description: 本场景对白简短，语法简单，适合初级学习者。

dialogues.text: Ok, Chandler, Mon, there's only one banana nut muffin left.
Oh, I ordered mine first.
Yeah, but I'm, I'm so much faster...
Give it to me.
No.
Give it to me.
Ok, you can have it.
[She grabs the coffee cup on the table and licks the rim.] There you go, enjoy your coffee.
That was there when I got here. [Takes a bite of his muffin.]
Hey you guys, you will never guess who's coming to New York.
Quick, Phoebe, tell us before he can swallow.
Oh ok, Ryan, that guy I went out with, who's in the Navy.
You went out with a guy in the Navy?
Yeah, I met him when I was playing guitar in Washington Square Park. Ryan threw in salt water taffy 'cause he didn't have any change.
Hey, is that when you wrote salt water taffy man?
No. No, he is my submarine guy. He resurfaces like every couple years and we have the most amazing three days together. Only this time he's coming for two weeks. Two whole weeks, which means yay.
So wait, this guy goes down for like two years at a time?
That'll teach you to lick my muffin.

scene: Ross informs the group about Ben's chicken pox
difficulty_description: 本场景对白主要涉及关于水痘的简短讨论，适合初级学习者。

dialogues.text: Hiii.
Oh no, what happened?
Well, I just spoke to Carol. Ben's got the chicken pox.
Oh no.
Yeah, so if you haven't already had it, chances are you're gonna get it.
Well I've had it.
Yeah, I've had it.
Had it.
Had it.
Well, I've never had it, I feel so left out. [Sees a red bump on her arm.] Oh look!

scene: Monica and Richard in Monica's bedroom
difficulty_description: 本场景对白涉及较长对话和复杂的情感交流，适合中级学习者。

dialogues.text: Honey, you made the bed again. I told you, you don't have to do that. This isn't camp.
Ooh, then I guess the panty raid last night was totally uncalled for. Ok, I am going to take a shower and today I will be singing Jim Crochee's Leroy Brown.

Monica... [He re-enters the bedroom and Monica jumps on the bed, trying to cover it.] Hey Mon, I have a question. Is Leroy the baddest man in the whole damn town or the fattest man in the whole damn town?
Baddest. Otherwise the song would be Fat Fat Leroy Brown.
What're you doing?
Just waiting for you sweetie.
Are you remaking the bed?
I'm sorry, I'm sorry. You know what, the way you did it was just fine.
Then, you're redoing it because...
If I tell you, you'll think I'm crazy.
You're pretty much running that risk either way.
Ok, you see, the tag shouldn't be at the top left corner, it should be at the bottom right corner.
Oh, well that's not so crazy.
I'm just easing you in.
Oh, alright.
Alright, you see these little flower blossoms? They should be facing up, not down, because, well, the head of the bed is where the sun would be. You don't love me any more do you.
Actually, if it's possible, I love you more.
Really? Wow, well then come on, I wanna show you how to fold the toilet paper into a point.

scene: Chandler's office where Joey visits
difficulty_description: 本场景涉及职场对话和幽默交流，适合中级学习者。

dialogues.text: Hey, look Joey, I'm just saying if you need something to hold you over, I can get you a job right here as an entry level processor.
But don't you need experience for a job like that?
It's not that hard to learn. And as for people realizing you have no idea what you're doing, hey, you're an actor. Act like a processor, people will think you're a processor.
Hey Chandler, here's this morning's projections.
Hey thanks. Scott Alexander, Joey Tribbianni. Joey is a uh, fellow processor.
No kidding.
Oh yeah yeah. I process. People want the processing, I'm the one they call.
Where do you work?
Uhh, well, right now I'm in between things. You know how it is. One day you're processing, the next day you're not so much... processing any more.
I was just telling Joey about the opening in Fleischman's group.
Fleischman's group. Whatever you do, don't touch his sandwiches. Ha-ha-ha...
Ha-ha. [Scott leaves] Are all you processors dorks?

scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment where they do Phoebe's makeup
difficulty_description: 本场景为简短、轻松的对白，适合初级学习者。

dialogues.text: Oh, this lipstick looks just great on you.
You look fabulous honey, you really do.
Yeah? Are you sure, really.
You see, you look beautiful. For god sakes, dim the lights.
I, I, I'm hideous.
It's gonna be ok. Ryan's been under water. He's just gonna be so glad that you don't have barnacles on your butt.

scene: Ryan returns to see Phoebe
difficulty_description: 本场景为中等难度，对话涉及复杂的情感交流，适合中级学习者。

dialogues.text: Come in.
Hey baby, I'm back... [Phoebe is sitting by the window in a veil.]
Hey Ryan, what's up?
What's goin' on?
Well, no no, you have to stay back. I, I have the pox.
Chicken or small?
Chicken. Which is so ironic considering I'm a vegetarian.
Why aren't you at home in bed?
'Cause my, my grandmother's never had chicken pox. Please, please tell me you have, 'cause oh my God, I forgot how cute you are.
I'm sorry, I never had 'em.
Ohh, ohh.
If I had one wish, it would be to build a time machine, go back to when I was 7, when Jimmy Hauser had the chicken pox. I would grab that kid and rub him all over my face.
Yeah, or you know, you could just wish that I didn't have them now.
Can I please see your face?
Nope. You don't want to see a face covered with pox.
Your face could be covered with lochs, I wouldn't care.
And you hate fish. Oh. That's so sweet, alright. Ok, alright, you can see. This is me... [she unveils herself right as a huge lightning bolt crashes outside. Ryan screams in terror.] Oh, I am scary.
Sorry, the lightning. Lightning was an unfortunate incidence. You look lovely, lovely.
I hate this. 'Cause I tell you, I had the most amazing two weeks planned for us, and almost everything I had in mind, we had to be a lot closer than this.
Phoebe, I have spent the last eight months in a steel tube with men, thinking about this moment. I am not gonna let a bunch of itchy spots stand between us.
Ok, this is the most romantic disease I've ever had.

scene: Joey和Chandler在Chandler的办公室讨论工作的第一天
difficulty_description: 包含较长的对话和一些复杂的句型，适合有一定英语基础的学习者。

dialogues.text: Hey.
Hey, how's the first day goin'?
Pretty good. It's like you said. It's mostly just putting numbers from one column into another column.
Well there you go.
Hey and everbody is so nice. I just had a good talk with that lady with the red hair, Jeannie.
Jeannie, the head of east coast operations Jeannie?
Yeah, turns out our kids go to the same school. Small world huh?
Weird world. Your kids?
I figure my character has kids.
Ya know there isn't a part of that sentence I don't need explained.
Well, see when you're acting you need to think about stuff like that. My character, Joseph the processor guy, has two little girls, Ashley and Brittany. Ashley copies everything Brittany does.
Well, invisible kids can be that way sometimes.
Yeah. Joseph and his wife, Karen, are thinking of having a third kid... Ya know what? Just did.
Really? Wow. That's some pretty powerful imaginary sperm you must have there.

scene: Phoebe和Ryan在Monica和Rachel的公寓中玩大富翁
difficulty_description: 对话包含一些较复杂的表达和互动，适合中等英语学习者。

dialogues.text: You know what makes the itching even worse?
That you don't stop talking about it.
Fine.
Let's just play, ok. Good, ok. Here we go, double sixes, here we go... Here we go, come to mama, just getting ready to roll the dice...
What're you doing? Are you scratching?
No. This is what I do for luck, ok.
You're scratching. Give me the dice.
No.
Give me the dice.
No. Here. There. Ooh, double sixes.
We can't scratch. You know we can't, we'll scar.
Uhh, I can't stop thinking about it. It's just so hard. I just wanna grab all these houses and rub 'em all over my body.
No.
Give it.
No.
Yeah, come on. You know you want it, you know you want it too, come on. Let's just be bad, it'll feel so good.
Oh God help me.
Now do me, do my back. Oh come on, harder.

scene: Joey和Chandler在Chandler的办公室里继续讨论Joseph的角色设定
difficulty_description: 一段工作环境中的对话，涉及一些专业术语和表达方式，适合作为中等难度的练习。

dialogues.text: You and Milton have to join us on the boat. Karen'll pack a lunch, you'll bring the kids, we'll make a day of it.
Oh, that sounds lovely. We're gonna have to set that up. Oh, I better get back. Hope the baby feels better.
Oh, thanks, thanks. Bye bye Jeannie.
Bye bye Joey.
What a phony.
Well, I'm sure you'll teach her a lesson when she steps off the dock onto nothing. Hey Mr. Douglas.
Sir.
Uh, listen Bing, I received your memo. So, we're not gonna receive the systems report until next Friday?
Well the people in my group wanna spend the holiday weekend with their families.
I have a family, I'm gonna be here.
Yeah Bing, what's that about?
It's about cutting my people a little slack, ya know, for morale. Look, if you wanna see some rough numbers, I can get them to you by Wednesday.
Rough numbers?
This company was not built on rough numbers. Am I right Mr. Douglas?
Have the final numbers on my desk by Tuesday.
Uh, if you say so sir.
Joseph's good, isn't he?
Well, I'm going to kill you.
Hey, hey, I just figure Joseph's the kinda guy that likes to mix it up. Ya know, get in there, ruffle some feathers.
Why?
Look, I'm sorry but that's what Joseph does, ok. If you try to pull somethin', he'll call you on it. 'What're you tryin' to pull,' he'll say.

scene: Monica和Richard在Monica的卧室里谈论Monica对细节的执着
difficulty_description: 对话涉及角色的个性化习惯和细节问题，使用了更细致的词汇和表达方式，适合中等英语学习者。

dialogues.text: Ooh, duct tape. Was I supposed to bring something too?
This is for the scratchy twins out there. I taped oven mits to their hands.
You're strict.
It's for their own good.
You know, I like the way you have efficiently folded this tab under. See in a tape emergency you could shave valuable seconds off your time.
Exactly. Oh, I love that I can be totally neurotic around you now. Tell me the truth. Don't you like it better now that everything on your desk is perpendicular?
If it's not a right angle, it is a wrong angle.
Very good.
Thank you.
You know what. Tomorrow I'm gonna do your clocks.
You're gonna do what to my clocks.
I'm gonna set them to my time.
Well, I'm confused. I thought we shared time.
No no. See, in my bedroom I set my clock six minutes fast. You wanna know why?
Because it's in a slightly different time zone than the kitchen.
No forget it, I'm not gonna tell you now.
No come on. Come on tell me.
No. See you don't understand.
Come on.
No. You don't have any of these cute little obsessive things.
No that's not true. That is not true.
Oh yeah.
Yeah.
Alright, well tell me one of yours.
Ok. Ahh. One of my things is, I always separate my sweat socks from my dress socks.
What if they get mixed up?
Boy I would just uh, I would freak out.
You would not. I can't believe this. I hate this, you're too normal. I can't believe my boyfriend doesn't have a thing. My boyfriend doesn't have a thing.
See, if anyone overheard that, I didn't come off well.

scene: Chandler和Joey在Chandler的办公室讨论Lender项目的问题
difficulty_description: 讨论涉及工作和角色设定的复杂互动，语法中等，适合有一定基础的学习者。

dialogues.text: Hey. Mr. Douglas is looking for you.
Why? Wh- wh- why is Mr. Douglas looking for me?
'Cause he has a strong suspicion that you dropped the ball on the Lender project.
Wha- wh- why, why, why does he suspect that?
Becasue at first he thought it was Joseph. But after he asked Joseph about it, turns out it was you. Anyway, I just thought you should know.

Alright, that's it. Look Joey, I'm sorry, I realize this is the role of a lifetime for ya, and if I could just fire Joseph, I would, but unfortunately that's not possible so I'm gonna have to let both of you go.
What're you talking about, everybody loves Joseph.
I don't, I hate Joseph, ok. I think he's a brown-nosing suck up.
Oh yeah. Well you can't fire Joseph. You know why, 'cause he's not in your department.
Alright, ok, alright. So I can't fire Joseph but uh, I can sleep with his wife.
Karen.
Yeah, Karen. I'm thinking about having an affair with her. Oh, you know what? I just did.
Ahh. What the hell are you doing to me man.

Oh well it's not me, it's my character, Chandy. Yeah the rogue processor who seduces his co-worker's wives for sport and then laughs about it the next day at the water cooler. In fact, I have her panties right there in my drawer.
Really?
No freakshow, she's fictional.
Take it easy. If it means that much to you, I'll uh, I'll go find something else.
Thank you.
It's just that, I, I'm gonna miss Joseph. I liked him. His wife, she was hot.

scene: Monica和Richard在Monica和Rachel的公寓里讨论Richard的小怪癖
difficulty_description: 该场景对话简单清晰，适合初级语言学习者练习。

dialogues.text: Monica, wake up. Monica.
What's up?
I thought of a thing.
Yeah?
Yeah. I have to sleep, have to, on this side of the bed.
No honey. You have to sleep on this side of the bed because I have to sleep on this side of the bed.
Or so I would have you believe.
No. Big deal, so you have a side of the bed, everybody has a side of the bed.
Hey come on, you haven't heard my reason yet.
Alright, go on.
Ok, I have to sleep on the west side because I grew up in California and otherwise the ocean would be on the wrong side.
Oh my God, you're a freak.
Yeah. How 'bout that.

scene: Monica 和朋友们讨论昨晚发生的事在 Monica 和 Rachel 的公寓
difficulty_description: 此场景包含稍长的对话，使用了复杂句型，适合具有中级英语水平的学习者。

dialogues.text: Ross kissed me.
Oh my god, oh my god, oh my god!
It was unbelievable!
Oh my god, oh my god, oh my god!
Ok, all right. We want to hear everything. Monica, get the wine and unplug the phone. Rachel, does this end well or do we need to get tissues?
Oh, it ended very well.
Oh.
[getting the wine] Do not start without me. Do not start without me.
Ok, all right, let's hear about the kiss. Was it like, was it like a soft brush against your lips? Or was it like a, you know, a 'I gotta have you now' kind of thing?
Well, at first it was really intense, you know. And then, oh, god, and then we just sort of sunk into it.
Ok, so, ok, was he holding you? Or was his hand like on your back?
No, actually first they started on my waist. And then, they slid up, and then, they were in my hair.
Ohhhh.

scene: Ross 和朋友们在 Ross 的公寓吃披萨讨论昨晚的吻
difficulty_description: 此场景包含简单的句子和词汇，适合初级学习者。

dialogues.text: And, uh, and then I kissed her.
Tongue?
Yeah.
Cool.

scene: 在 Central Perk，Chandler 正在展示他的新电脑
difficulty_description: 此场景包含适度复杂的技术和日常对话，对于中级学习者是个不错的挑战

dialogues.text: All right, check out this bad boy. 12 megabytes of ram. 500 megabyte hard drive. Built-in spreadsheet capabilities and a modem that transmits at over 28,000 b.p.s.
Wow. What are you gonna use it for?
[doggedly] Games and stuff.
[reading the paper] There are no jobs. There are no jobs for me.
[reading over her shoulder] Wait, here's one. Uh, would you be willing to cook naked?
There's an ad for a naked chef?
No, but if you're willing to cook naked, then you might be willing to dance naked. And then... [rubs his fingers together]
Hi.
Hey, oh, so, um...how'd you make out last night?
That, that is funny. That is painfully funny. No, wait. Wait, yeah, that's just painful.
Wait a minute. I thought last night was great.

Yeah, it was, but...I get home, ok, and I see Julie's saline solution on my night table. And I'm thinking to myself, oh my god, what the hell am I doing? I mean, here I am, I am with Julie, this incredible, great woman, who I care about and who cares about me, and I'm like, what, am I just gonna throw all that away?
You got all that from saline solution?
We are talking about Rachel here. You and Rachel.

Believe me, I've been dreaming about me and Rachel for ten years now. But now, I'm with Julie, so it's like me and Julie, me and Rachel, me and Julie, me and... [Rachel enters, carrying a tray]... Rachel. Rachel, Rachel.
[to Ross] Hey, you.
How are you?
Good. How are you?
Good.
Hi, honey.
Hi, Julie. [nervous] Hi, Julie. Julie, um, how are you?
Good.
[uncomfortable] Good, so everybody's here. Everybody's good. So, were you gonna play something, Phoebe?
Oh, well, actually.
[impatient] Play it.
Ok, all right.
Hey, Julie, I didn't know you wore lenses.
What?
[to Joey] Ssshh.
Ok, um, hi, hello, hi, ok, so, um, this is a song about a love triangle between three people that I made up. Um, it's called, um, 'Two of Them Kissed Last Night'.

[singing] There was a girl, we'll call her Betty, and a guy let's call him Neil. Now I can't stress this point too strongly, this story isn't real. Now our Neil must decide, who will be the girl that he casts aside. Will Betty be the one who he loves truly? Or will it be the one who we'll call Ju...Loolie? He must decide, he must decide, even though I made him up, he must decide!

scene: Monica 面试 Mockolate 工作
difficulty_description: 此场景包含相关的工作对话，适合具有中级英语水平的学习者。

dialogues.text: This is a nice resume. Nice, nice, nice. Muy impressivo.
So, Mr. Rastatter, what exactly does this job entail? The ad wasn't too clear.
Mockolate.
I'm sorry?
Mockolate. It's a completely synthetic chocolate substitute.
Ohh.
Go ahead. Try a piece. Yeah, we think that Mockolate is even better than chocolate.
All right. Mmm-mmm.
Yeah?
[disgusted, trying not to show it] I love how it crumbles. Now see, your chocolate doesn't do that.

No, ma'am. Well, anyhoo, we should be getting our F.D.A. approval any day now, hopefully, in time for Thanksgiving. See, the way we look at it, chocolate already dominates most of your major food-preparation holidays: Easter, Christmas, what have you.
[still chewing] Mmm-mmm.
But, we're thinking, given the right marketing, we can make Thanksgiving the Mockolate holiday.
Wow.
Aren't you going to swallow that?
Just waiting for it to stop bubbling.
Yeah, isn't that great?
[with false enthusiasm] Mmm.
Well, anyhoo, um, we are looking for a couple of chefs who can create some Thanksgiving-themed recipes. You think you might be interested?
Abso...[swallows hard]...lutely. See, I love creating new recipes. I love Thanksgiving. And, well, now, I love Mockolate.
Really?
Especially the after taste, you know, I'll tell ya, that'll last ya till Christmas.

scene: Monica 和 Phoebe 在公寓里讨论 Mockolate 甜点
difficulty_description: 此场景包含简单的日常对话，适合初级学习者。

dialogues.text: How about Mockolate mousse?
It's not, it's not very Thanksgiving-y.
Ok, how about pilgrim Mockolate mousse?
What makes it pilgrim?
We'll put buckles on it.
Hey.
Hey.
Hey.
Did uh, Ross call?
No, I'm sorry.

Why didn't he call? He's gonna stay with Julie, isn't he? He's gonna stay with her and she's going to be all, 'Hi, I'm Julie, Ross picked me, and we're gonna to get married, have a lot of kids and dig up stuff together.'
No offense, but that sounds nothing like her.

scene: Ross 在 Chandler 和 Joey 的公寓里讨论 Rachel/Julie 的情况
difficulty_description: 对话包含一些复杂的句型和词汇，适合具备一定英语基础的学习者

dialogues.text: I don't know what to do. What am I gonna do? I mean, this, this is like a complete nightmare.
Oh, I know. This must be so hard. Oh, no. Two women love me. They're both gorgeous and sexy. My wallet's too small for my fifties, and my diamond shoes are too tight.
Hey, here's a thought, Ross.
Don't touch the computer. Don't ever touch the computer.
Ross, listen. I got two words for you. Threesome.

Ok, all right, look. Let's get logical about this, ok? We'll make a list. Rachel and Julie, pros and cons. Oh. We'll put their names in bold, with different fonts, and I can use different colors for each column.
Can't we just use a pen?
No, Amish boy.
Ok, let's start with the cons, 'cause they're more fun. All right, Rachel first.
I don't know. I mean, all right, I guess you can say she's a little spoiled sometimes.
You could say that.

And I guess, you know, sometimes, she's a little ditzy, you know. And I've seen her be a little too into her looks. Oh, and Julie and I, we have a lot in common 'cause we're both paleontologists, but Rachel's just a waitress.
Waitress. Got it. You guys wanna play Doom? Or we could keep doing this. What else?
I don't know.
Oh, her ankles are a little chubby.
Ok, let's do Julie. What's wrong with her?
[long pause] She's not Rachel.

scene: Monica 和 Rachel 的公寓, Monica 为 Phoebe 和 Rachel 准备食物品尝
difficulty_description: 对话句子较短，语法简单，适合初级学习者

dialogues.text: Ok, this is pumpkin pie with mockolate cookie crumb crust. This is mockolate cranberry cake, and these are mockolate chip cookies. Just like the Indians served.
Oh my god.
Oh my god good?
Oh my god, I can't believe you let me put this in my mouth.
Oh, oh sweet Lord! This is what evil must taste like!

scene: Chandler 和 Joey 的公寓, Chandler 打电话给一个电脑热线
difficulty_description: 对话包含一些复杂的句型和词汇，适合具备一定英语基础的学习者

dialogues.text: I'm telling you this thing won't print. Yes, I pressed that button like 100 times. You know, for a hot line you are not so hot. What? What is that in the background? Are you watching Star Trek?
[to Ross] Hey, so how'd it go with Julie? Did you, did you break her heart?
Yes, it was horrible. She cried. I cried. She threw things, they hit me. Anyway, I did the right thing.
[in phone] So, Spock actually hugs his father?
Hey, do you guys have...[sees Ross, pauses]...hi.
Hi.
[sees his coat on] Where you goin'?
I uh, I just got back from uh, from Julie's.
[dejected] Oh.
No, no, uh, it's not what you think. It's um the other thing.
Well, what's the other thing, what do I think?
He broke up with Julie. Well, go hug her, for god's sakes.
Really?
Really. It's always been you, Rach.
Oh, god.
Ohhh.
Oh, oh, this is good, this is really good.
I know, I know, it's, it's almost...[turns around, sees Chandler and Joey] What do you say we go take a walk, just us, not them?
Let me get my coat.
Ok. No, hey, whoa, whoa, I'll get your coat.
Ok, he's goin' to get my coat. He's goin' to get my coat. Oh my god, you guys. I can't believe this. This is unbelievable. [notices Chandler's computer screen] What's that?
[nervous] What? Nothing.
What's that? What? I saw my name. What is it?
No, no, see? See? [the printer starts to run] Hey, it's printing. [to Joey, rattled] Hey, it's printing!
Well what is it? Let me see.
Hey, someone order a coat?
Ross, Chandler wrote something about me on his computer and he won't let me see.
He won't? [remembers what it is] He won't! Because, isn't that, isn't that the, the short story you were writing?
Yes, yes it is, short story, that I was writing.
And I'm in it? Then let me read it.
No!
Come on.
Hey, uh, why don't you read it to her?
[through gritted teeth] Alright. [clears his throat] 'It was summer, and it was hot. Rachel was there. A lonely gray couch. 'Oh, look,' cried Ned, and then the kingdom was his forever. The end.'
That's it? That's all you wrote? You're the worst writer in the whole world.
All right, you know what? This isn't funny anymore. There's something about me on that piece of paper and I want to see it.
No, you don't.
All right, you know what, that's fine. If you guys want to be children about this, that's fine. I do not need to see it. [Rachel grabs the paper and runs across the room, reading it to herself.]
What is this? Ross, what is this?
Good luck.
Ok, just, just remember how crazy I am about you, ok?
Kind of ditzy? Too into her looks? Spoiled?
Now that's a little spoiled. He was supposed to type 'little', the idiot.
Just a waitress?
No, that, that was, I mean, as opposed to uh, the uh, ok. Is this over yet Rach?
Oh! I do not have chubby ankles!

scene: Central Perk, Chandler, Monica, Joey, 和 Phoebe 讨论此前的事件
difficulty_description: 对话包含一些复杂的句型和词汇，适合具备一定英语基础的学习者

dialogues.text: My diary! My diary, that's brilliant. I should have told her it was my diary, she never would have made me read her my diary.
You know, that's true. You'd be a great person to have around the day after an emergency.
I... I cannot believe Ross even made this list. What a dinkus.
Hey, cut him some slack. It was Chandler's idea.
What?
What?
Oh good, I was hoping that would come up.
This was your idea?
What were you thinking?
[squirming] All right, let's get some perspective here, ok? These things, they happen for a reason.
Yeah. You!
All right, Pheebs, back me up here, ok? You believe in that karma crap, don't you?
Yeah, by the way, good luck in your next life as a dung beetle.

scene: Ross 在试图靠窗进入 Monica 和 Rachel 的公寓
difficulty_description: 对话包含情感交流和一些复杂句型，适合有一定英语基础的学习者。

dialogues.text: Rach! Whoops! Rach, hey, open up, please!
[coldly] When somebody does not buzz you in, Ross, that means go away. That doesn't mean please climb up the fire escape.
I just wanna read something. It's your pro list.
Not interested.

Ok, ok, number one: The way you cry at game shows. Number two: how much you love your friends. Number three: the way you play with your hair when you're nervous. Number four: how brave you are for starting your life over. Number five: how great you are with Ben.
Number six: the way you smell.
Hey, Ross! What are you doin'?
Hey, Joey. You wanna open the window?
Oh, yeah, I do.
What are you doing out there?
I am, uh, I am...
Oh, you must be freezing. You know what you need? How about a nice steaming cup of hot Mockolate?
Rach, come on, open up. Rach, come on, come on, Rach. You got to give me another chance.
No.
No?
That's what I said.
Look, maybe we should go?
No, you guys, you really don't have to go, we're done talking.
Rach, come on, look, I know how you must feel.

[near tears] No, you don't, Ross. Imagine the worst things you think about yourself. Now, how would you feel if the one person that you trusted the most in the world not only thinks them too, but actually uses them as reasons not to be with you.
No, but, but I wanna be with you in spite of all those things.
Oh, well, that's, that's mighty big of you, Ross. [to the others] I said don't go!
You know what? You know what? If, things were the other way around, there's nothing you could put on a list that would ever make me not want to be with you.
Well, then, I guess that's the difference between us. See, I'd never make a list.
[quietly] I never know how long you're supposed to wait in this type of a situation before you can talk again, you know?
Maybe a little longer.

scene: Monica 与 Mr. Ratstatter 在讨论食谱
difficulty_description: 涉及食品成分和专业名词，适合具备一定词汇量的学习者。

dialogues.text: Now, in some of these recipes, the quantities may seem just a little unusual, uh, like these coconut mockolate holiday nut bars. I've indicated four cups of coconut, and four cups of crushed nut, and only, uh, one tablespoon of mockolate.
Doesn't matter.
What?
Our FDA approval didn't come through. Something about laboratory rats.
Oh, gosh, I'm sorry.
Yeah, well, anyhoo, here is your check. Thank you for all the trouble you went through. Um, listen, you didn't eat a lot of it while you were cooking, did you?
Well, uh, I ate some.
Oh, some, that's fine. Some is fine. Some is not a lot. So, it doesn't burn when you pee, does it?

scene: Ross 从他公寓打电话给 Monica 和 Rachel 的公寓
difficulty_description: 对话包含请求和安慰情感，适合有一定基础的学习者。

dialogues.text: Hello?
Hi.
[to Monica] Is that him again? Tell him I'd come to the phone, but my ankles are weighin' me down.
[to Ross] Listen, I... I don't think this is the best time.
Look, can, can you do something for me?
Sure, what? Ok, ok.
[to Rachel] Music?
The next one's dedicated to Rachel from Ross. Rachel, he wants you to know he's deeply sorry for what he did and he hopes you can find it in your heart to forgive him.

Uh, we've just gotten a call from Rachel, and she told us what Ross did. It's pretty appalling, and Ross, if you're listening, I don't wanna play your song anymore. Why don't we devote our time to a couple that stands a chance? Avery, Michelle's sorry she hit you with her car and she hopes you two will work it out.

scene: Monica 再次在 Mr. Ratstatter 的办公室
difficulty_description: 对话包含幽默和专业术语，适合具备一定词汇量的学习者。

dialogues.text: Hi, thanks for coming in again.
Oh, not at all. I have no morals and I need the cash.

It's like I'm lookin' in a mirror. Anyway, they're called 'fishtachios'. They taste exactly like pistachios, but they're made primarily of reconstituted fish bits. Here, try one. You're not allergic to anything, are you?
Cat hair.
Oh, sorry.

scene: Ross's apartment where Carol and Susan are picking Ben up
difficulty_description: 此场景涉及复杂的情感表达和角色之间的关系，有一定长度的对话，适合具备一定英语基础的学习者。

dialogues.text: Ok. Here's his diaper bag, and his uh, Mr. Winky, and uh...oh, him. Hi!
So how did everything go?
Oh, great. Great. There was a projectile, uh, throwing up incident, but he started it.
Well, we've gotta go.
Ok.
[clears her throat]
Oh, right. Um, I've got some news. It's about us.
Oh, you and me?
Uh, no, Susan and me.
The other us.
Ok.
We're uh, we're getting married.
As in, 'I now pronounce you wife and wife' married?
Anyway, we'd like you to come, but we totally understand if you don't want to.
Why wouldn't I want to come? I had fun at the first wedding.
Look I just thought that...
No no no, I mean, hey, why shouldn't I be happy for you? What would it say about me if I couldn't revel in your joy? I'm revelling baby, believe me!
Is your finger caught in that chair?
Mmm hmmm.
Want us to go?
Uh-huh.

scene: Rachel and Monica's apartment where friends discuss Joey's TV role
difficulty_description: 此场景的对话段落较长，涉及多种话题转换，需要分析语言和背景，适合中级学习者。

dialogues.text: This is so cool. You're actually gonna be on television.
It really hit me last night. I'm gonna be on Days of our Lives. And then I started thinkin' about all of u, and how these are the days of our lives.
Yes! Carol and Susan's caterer had a mountain bike accident this weekend, and she's in a full body cast.
Yes!
They want me to do it, which is really cool, seeing as I've never catered before, and I really need the money, and this isn't a problem for you, is it?
Would it matter?
Oh, you are so great! [kisses him] Thank you!
Are you really not going?
I am really not going. I don't get it. They already live together, why do they need to get married?
They love each other, and they wanna celebrate that love with the people that are close with them.
If you wanna call that a reason.
[singing to the tune of Mister Rogers' Neighborhood] Who's the bitterest man in the living room, the bitterest man in the living room? Hi, neighbor.
Ross, I thought you were over this.
Look, that has nothing to do with this, ok? She's my ex-wife. If she were marrying a guy, none of you'd expect me to be there.
Hey, if she were marrying a guy, she'd be like the worst lesbian ever.
[entering hurriedly] Did I miss it? Did I miss it?
No, I'm on right after this guy shoots himself.
Whoa, she's pretty.
Yeah, and she's really nice too. She taught me all about how to work the cameras, and smell-the-fart acting.
I'm sorry, what?
What?

It's like, you got so many lines to learn so fast, that sometimes you need a minute to remember your next one. So while you're thinkin' of it, you take this big pause where you look all intense, you know, like this.
Oh, ok.
There's my scene, there's my scene. [Joey on tv] 'Mrs. Wallace, I'm Dr. Drake Ramoray, your sister's neurosurgeon.'
Is she gonna be all right?
I'm afraid the situation is much worse than we expected. Your sister is suffering from a..subcranial hematoma. Perhaps we can discuss this over coffee.
Nice!
That's great!
Excellent!
For a minute there I thought you were actually tryin' to smell something.

scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment where Phoebe shares her unusual experience
difficulty_description: 此场景的语法结构相对复杂，句子较长，有较多情境对话和突发事件，适合中级学习者。

dialogues.text: That is so good! Do it again!
All right, all right. 'Damnit Braverman, it's right there on the chart!'
That's great. All right, I gotta get to work, I got a big dinosaur bone to inspect.
No no, that's me.
Oh, yeah.
Oh, hello.
Oh, thanks. I couldn't uh...
Is everything ok?
Um, no, huh-uh. One of my clients died on the massage table today.
Oh my god.
That's a little more relaxed than you want them to get.
Yeah, um, she was 82 years old. Her name was um, Mrs. Adelman.
Oh, honey.

Yeah, it's just so strange. I mean, she probably woke up today and thought, 'ok, I'll have some breakfast, and then I'll take a little walk, and then I'll have my massage.' Little did she know God was thinking, 'Ok, but that's it.' Oh, but the weirdest thing was, ok, I was cleansing her aura when she died, and when the spirit left her body, I don't think it went very far.
What do you mean?
I think it went into me.
[Everyone takes a step back from Phoebe]

scene: Central Perk where Monica, Chandler, Rachel, Ross, Joey and Phoebe are discussing various topics
difficulty_description: 此场景包含多角色的对话，话题变化频繁，语音表达复杂，适合中级学习者。

dialogues.text: God, this is so hard. I can't decide between lamb or duck.
Well, of course, lambs are scarier. Otherwise the movie would've been called Silence of the Ducks.
Ok, who ordered what?
Oh, I believe I had the half-drunk cappuccino with the lipstick on the rim.
Yes, and this with the cigarette butt in it, is that decaf?
Oh god.
I can't believe you're so uptight about your mom comin'.
I know, but it's just it's the first time, and I just don't want her to think that because I didn't marry Barry, that my life is total crap, you know?
[Mrs. Adelman's voice] Talk about crap. Try listening to Stella Niedman tell the story of her and Rod Steiger for the hundredth time.
Uh, Pheebs, how long do you think this lady'll be with us?
I don't know. I mean, she obviously has some kind of unfinished business. [Mrs. Adelman's voice] Sit up!
[entering] There she is.
Mom!
Sweetie! So this is where you work? Oh, it's wonderful! Is it a living room? Is it a restaurant? Who can tell? But I guess that's the fun.
Pretty much.
Monica! You look gorgeous! Last time I saw you, it was eat or be eaten.
This is Joey, and Phoebe, and this is Chandler, and you remember Ross.
Oh hello, Ross.
Hi, Mrs. Green. [He gets up to shake her hand, but she ignores him.]
So, what do you think of my daughter in the apron with the big job?
Oh Mom!
If you didn't pour the coffee, no one would have anything to drink.
Believe me, sometimes that happens.
This is just so exciting. You know, I never worked. I went straight from my father's house to the sorority house to my husband's house. I am just so proud of you.
Really?
Yes.
I know who it is you remind me of. Evelyn Dermer. 'Course, that's before she got the lousy face lift. Now she looks like Soupy Sales.
Pheebs, who's Evelyn Dermer?
I don't know. Who's Soupy Sales?

scene: at Rachel and Monica's apartment, discussing various personal matters
difficulty_description: 此场景包含多个角色间复杂的对话，涉及个人问题，语法复杂，适合高级学习者。

dialogues.text: Oh my god, there's an unattractive nude man playing the cello.
Yeah, well just be glad he's not playing a smaller instrument.
[laughing] You have some life here, sweetie.

I know. And Mom, I realize you and Daddy were upset when I didn't marry Barry and get the big house in the suburbs with all the security and everything, but this is just so much better for me, you know?
I do. You didn't love Barry. And I've never seen you this happy. I look at you and I think, oh, this is what I want.
For...me.
Well, not just for you.
Well, what do you mean?
I'm uh, considering leaving your father.
[entering] All right. Tell me if this is too cute. Lesbian wedding, chicken breasts.
Oh god. I think I'm gonna be sick.
Why? It's not like I'm putting little nipples on them.
And you had no idea they weren't getting along?
None.
They didn't fight a lot?
No! They didn't even talk to each other. God, how was I supposed to know they were having problems?
[Mrs. Adelman's voice] In my day, divorce was not an option.
Hey, look who's up.
I just can't believe this is happening. I mean, when I was little, everybody's parents were getting divorced. I just figured as a grownup I wouldn't have to worry about this.
Is there any chance that you can look at this as flattering? I mean, she's doing it because she wants to be more like you.
Well, then, you know, couldn't she have just copied my haircut?
You know, it's funny when my parents got divorced, they sent me to this shrink, and she told me that all kids have a tendency to blame themselves. But in your case it's actually kinda true.

scene: Phoebe meets with Mr. Adelman about his late wife's spirit
difficulty_description: 此场景包含中等长度的对话，涉及幽默和灵异话题，适合中级学习者。

dialogues.text: That's him.
Damn. My mail order grandfather hasn't come yet.
Phoebe?
Yes, hi, Mr. Adelman. Thanks for meeting me.
Oh, that's all right, although you did cut into my busy day of sitting.
Um, do you wanna sit?
Oh, no, please, I spent most of mid-morning trying to stand up. Now uh, what can I do for you, my dear?
I don't know how to say this, but I think when your wife's spirit left her body, it um, kind of stuck around in me.
You're saying, my wife is in you?
Yeah. Ok, you don't have to believe me but um, can you think of any unfinished business she might have had, like any reason she'd be hanging around?
Well, I don't know what to tell you dear. The only thing I can think of is that she always used to say that before she died, she wanted to see everything.
Everything?
Everything.
Whoa, that's a lot of stuff.
Oh, wait, I remember, she also said she wanted to sleep with me one last time.
I'm sorry, there's laughing in my head.
[to Joey] Worth a shot, huh?
[nods and shrugs]

scene: Rachel and her mother look at old photos while Monica gets help with dinner preparations
difficulty_description: 此场景涉及回忆和家庭对话，语法和词汇较为常见，适合中级学习者。

dialogues.text: Look at this.
These are from Halloween three years ago.
Oh, look, here's Barry. Did he have to come straight from the office?
No, that was his costume. See, he's actually an orthodontist, but he came as a regular dentist.
Um, you guys, you know when I said before, 'thank you, but I don't really need your help'?
Actually, what I think you said was, 'don't touch that, and get the hell out of my kitchen.'
Really? Weird. Anyway, see, I planned everything really well. I planned and I planned and I planned. It just turns out, I don't think I planned enough time to actually do it.
Hey, Mon, you want some help?
If you want.
[enters] Hey. What a day. I took her everywhere. The Museum of Modern Art, Rockefeller Center, Statue of Liberty.

scene: Mrs. Green discusses her sexual history and current curiosities
difficulty_description: 此场景涉及成人话题和幽默，适合有一定语法和词汇基础的学习者。

dialogues.text: She's still with you?
Yeah. I guess she hasn't seen everything yet. I'll be right back, she has to go to the bathroom again. [Takes Mrs. Green's chin in her hand and says, in Mrs. Adelman's voice] Oh, such a pretty face.
This is so much fun, just the girls. You know what we should do? Does anybody have any marijuana?
God!
All right, look, nobody's smoking pot around all this food.
That's fine. I never did it. I just thought I might. So, what's new in sex?
Oh! What's new in sex?
The only man I've ever been with is your father.
I'm dicing, I'm dicing, I don't hear anything.
I mean, this is no offense to your dad, sweetie, but I was thinking there might be more.

Oh, I'm sorry. You know what? I cannot have this conversation with you. I mean, god, you just come in here, and drop this bomb on me, before you even tell Daddy. What? What do you want? Do you want my blessing?
No.
You want me to talk you out of it?
No.
Then what? What do you want?
I guess I just figured of all people you would understand this.
Why on earth would I understand this?
You didn't marry your Barry. I did.

scene: Monica prepares food for the wedding, multiple characters help
difficulty_description: 此场景包含组织协作中的对话，适合具有中级语法和词汇基础的学习者。

dialogues.text: All right people, we're in trouble here. We've only got 12 hours and 36 minutes left. Move, move, move!
Monica, I feel like you should have German subtitles.
Joey, speed it up!
I'm sorry, it's the pigs. They're reluctant to get in the blankets!
Monica, how did this happen? I thought you had this all planned out.
Do you want me to cry? Is that what you want? Do you wanna see me cry?
Sir! No sir!
[to Ross] All right, you!
No. Look, I told you I am not a part of this thing.

All right, look, Ross. I realize that you have issues with Carol and Susan, and I feel for you, I do. But if you don't help me cook, I'm gonna take a bunch of those little hot dogs, and I'm gonna create a new appetizer called 'pigs in Ross'. All right, ball the melon.
Hey! How come I'm stuck dicing, when he gets to ball the melon.

scene: Carol arrives and the wedding plans are discussed
difficulty_description: 此场景围绕婚礼筹备展开，适合具备中级语法和词汇基础的学习者。

dialogues.text: [knock at the door] Hi.
How's it going?
It's goin' great. Right on schedule. Got my little happy helpers.[everyone groans]
Fine, whatever.
What's the matter?
Nothing. Ok, everything. I think we're calling off the wedding.
What?
You're still gonna pay me, right? Or something a little less selfish.
Carol, what's the matter? What happened?
My parents called this afternoon to say they weren't coming.
Oh my god.
I mean, I knew they were having trouble with this whole thing, but they're my parents. They're supposed to give me away and everything.
It's ok. I'm sorry.

And then Susan and I got in this big fight because I said maybe we should call off the wedding, and she said we weren't doing it for them, we were doing it for us, and if I couldn't see that, then maybe we should call off the wedding. I don't know what to do.
I uh can't believe I'm gonna say this, but I think Susan's right.
You do?
Look, do you love her? And you don't have to be too emphatic about this.
Of course I do.

Well then that's it. And if George and Adelaide can't accept that, then the hell with them. Look, if my parents didn't want me to marry you, no way that would have stopped me. Look, this is your wedding. Do it.
You're right. Of course you're right.
So we're back on?
We're back on.
You heard the woman. Peel, chop, devil! I can't believe I lost 2 minutes.

scene: Joey and Chandler discuss Joey's romantic frustrations at the wedding
difficulty_description: 此场景包含简短的对话，适合初级学习者。

dialogues.text: It just seems so futile, you know ? All these women, and nothing. I feel like Superman without my powers, you know? I have the cape, and yet I cannot fly.
Well now you understand how I feel every single day, ok? The world is my lesbian wedding.

scene: Carol 和 Susan 的婚礼
difficulty_description: 此场景包含几种不同场合的对话，涉及不同角色，有较长句子和复杂句型，适合具有一定基础的学习者。

dialogues.text: Thank you.
Any time.
Ross.
You know, nothing makes God happier than when two people, any two people, come together in love. Friends, family, we're gathered here today to join Carol and Susan in holy matrimony.
[Mrs. Adelman's voice] Oh my god. Now I've seen everything! [Phoebe's voice] Whoa, she's gone. She's gone. She's gone! Go ahead, get married. Go, go.

scene: 婚礼招待会
difficulty_description: 此场景包含不同角色之间的对话，句型复杂，需要一定的语法和词汇基础，适合中级学习者。

dialogues.text: Would you look at them?
Yeah, can't help but.
[to a wedding guest] How's that pig-in-the-blanket workin' out for ya? [the guy nods] I wrapped those bad boys.
I miss Rose.
Oh, yeah?
I know it's kind of weird, but I mean, she was a big part of my life there, you know, and now I just feel kind of alone.
You know, I uh, I couldn't help but overhear what you just said, and I think it's time for you to forget about Rose, move on with your life...how 'bout we go get you a drink?
Ok, that's so nice.
[to an attractive woman] I shouldn't even bother coming up with a line, right? [The woman walks away]
Hey, Mom? Having fun?
Oh, am I! I just danced with a wonderfully large woman. And three other girls made eyes at me over the buffet. Oh, I'm not saying it's something I wanna pursue, but it's nice to know I have options.
There's more alcohol, right?

scene: Susan 和 Ross 在婚礼上谈话
difficulty_description: 此场景对话较短，情感交流直接，适合初级学习者。

dialogues.text: How you doin'?
Ok.
You did a good thing today.
Yeah.
You wanna dance?
No, that's fine.
Come on. I'll let you lead.
Ok.

scene: Chandler 和一位女性在婚礼上
difficulty_description: 此场景对话简短，适合初级英语学习者。

dialogues.text: [to the woman who just rejected him] All right look. Penis schmenis. We're all people.

scene: Monica 和朋友们讨论婚姻
difficulty_description: 此场景讨论婚姻，涉及多角色和复杂句型，适合具有一定英语基础的学习者。

dialogues.text: Ok, which one of us do you think is gonna be the first one to get married?
Well, Mon, I was married.
Yeah, me, too, technically.
I had a wedding.
All right, just trying to start an interesting discussion.
I got one. Which one of us do you think will be the last to get married?
[They all look at Chandler]
Isn't Ben in this?
Oh, yeah!

scene: Chandler and Joey's apartment. Chandler is playing foosball by himself, Joey enters
difficulty_description: 此场景包含普通日常对话，适中语速，有适度笑点，适合有一定英语基础的学习者。

dialogues.text: Hey.
Hey. Hold on a second. [shoots a goal] Huh?
Nice, nice. Hey I got somethin' for you.
What's this?
Eight hundred and twelve bucks.
Well, I don't know what Big Leon told ya but it's an even thousand if you want me for the whole night. What is this for?
Well, I'm makin money now and this is payin' you back for head shots, electric bills, and so many slices of pizza I can't even count. I love ya man.
Well, thanks man. Now I can get my pony.
Hey, this is a little extra somethin' for uh, ya know, always bein' there for me.
Wow, I don't know what to say. [opens the box and pulls out an incredibly gaudy gold bracelet] Wow, I, I don't know what to say.
Heh, what d'ya say?
I don't know. It's a bracelet.
Isn't it? And it's engraved too, check it out.
[reads] To my best bud. [puts it back in the case] Thanks best bud.
Put it on.
Oh, now? [puts it in his desk drawer] No, no, I think something this nice should be saved for a special occasion.

Oh, no no, that's the beauty part, it goes with everything. [gets the bracelet from the drawer] You put this on, you're good to go. [puts the bracelet on Chandler] Ohhh man, you are so wearin' that bracelet.
I so am.
You have any idea what this'll do for your sex life?
Well, it'll probably slow it down at first but, once I get used to the extra weight, I'll be back on track.

scene: A kitchen somewhere. Monica is interviewing for a job
difficulty_description: 此场景包含职场对话，需理解专业术语和对话意图，适合中高级英语学习者。

dialogues.text: Well, this all looks good.
Great.
And if I want to call for a reference on your last job?
Oh, that's there on the bottom, see the manager, Chandler Bing.
Alright, lets see if you're as good in person as you are on paper. Make me a salad.
A salad? Really I, I could do something a little more complicated if you like.
No, just a salad will be fine.
You got it.
Now, I want you to tell me what you're doing while you're doing it.
Alright, well I'm tearing the lettuce.
Uh-huh. Is it dirty?
Oh-oh, no no don't worry, I'm gonna wash it.
Don't, I like it dirty.
That's your call.
So, uh, what are you going to do next?
Well, I thought that I would cut up the tomatoes.
Are they, uh, firm?
They're alright.
You sure they haven't gone bad? You're sure they're not very, very bad?
No really, they're OK.
You gonna slice them up real nice?
Actually, I was gonna do them julienne.
Aaaahhhhhhh.
I'm outa here.

scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Chandler and Phoebe are sitting at the couch. Ross is sitting at the table and answers the phone.
difficulty_description: 此场景包含丰富的情感交流和口语化表达，适合提升日常交流能力学习者。

dialogues.text: Y-ello. No, Rachel's not here right now, can I take a message? Alright, and how do we spell Casey, is it like at the bat or and the Sunshine Band? OK, bye-bye. Hey, who's this uh, this Casey?
Oh, some guy she met at the movies.
Oh really? What uh, what does he want with her?
Well, I'm guessing he wants to do a little dance. . . ya know, make a little love. . . well pretty much get down tonight.

I don't know, I don't get, I don't get it, I mean, wh, wh, two months ago Rachel and I were like, this close. Right now, what, I'm takin messages from guys she, she meets at the movies? I mean this, this Casey should be takin' down my messages, ya know, or, or, Rachel and I should be together and, and we should get some kind of me, message service.
Hang in there, it's gonna happen.
Wha, OK, now how do you know that?
Because she's your lobster.
Oh, she's goin' somewhere.
C'mon you guys. It's a known fact that lobsters fall in love and mate for life. You know what, you can actually see old lobster couples walkin' around their tank, ya know, holding claws like. . .
Hey, you feelin' better?
Yeah, I think that fifth shower actually got the interview off me.
So, do you have any other possibilities?
Oh yeah, well there's the possibility that I won't make rent.
Monica, if you want, I can lend you some money.
No no no, if I couldn't pay you back right away then I'd feel guilty and tense every time I saw you.
Oh OK. Well then why don't you, uhh, why don't you borrow it from mom and dad? You feel guilty and tense around them already. You might as well make some money off of them.
Ya know, the man's got a point.
What is that sparkly thing?
That thing, it's a uhh. . . yeah it's, it's a little flashy.
No no, no no, it's not flashy, not for a Goodfella.
Man, man that is sharp. It must have cost you quite a few debloons.

scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Monica answers the door and lets her parents in. They are carrying boxes.
difficulty_description: 此场景包含基础家庭对话，句型简单清晰，适合初级学习者。

dialogues.text: Hi.
Hi.
Hi darling.
So, what's this.
Some of your old stuff.
Well sweetie, we have a surprise for you. We're turning your room into a gym.
Wow, that is a surprise. Just one little question, uh, why not Ross's room?
Gosh, we talked about that but your brother has so many science trophies and plaques and merit badges, well we didn't want to disturb them.
Oh, God forbid.
Hi.
Oh, hi Rachel.
Hi.
Oh, we were so sorry to hear about your parents splitting up, dear.
Oh, well, you know, they're just separated so, you know, never know, we'll see.
Well, I can't say any of us were surprised. Your parents have been unhappy ever since we've known them. Especially after that incident in Hawaii.
What, what incident?
Uhh, naa, no no no, I, I must be thinking of someone else, uh, maybe me. Don't you have some folding to do? Go fold dear. Fold. You fold.

scene: Phoebe 和 Chandler 在 Central Perk 聊天，一位漂亮的女士在看 Chandler
difficulty_description: 此场景包含一些复杂句型和较长对话，适合有一定基础的学习者。

dialogues.text: Do you want a refill?
No, I'm alright, thanks.
OK. Ooh, OK, you gotta give me a second, I wanna get this just right. Dude, 11 o'clock, totally hot babe checkin' you out. That was really good, I think I'm ready for my penis now.
[walks over to the woman] I know what you're thinking, Dave Thomas, founder of Wendy's.
I'm Gail.
Chandler. [waves his arm around, exposing the bracelet]
I, I really have to be somewhere but it was nice meeting you.

What? [realizes it was the bracelet] Oh this is excellent. You know he coulda gotten me a VCR, he coulda gotten me a set of golf clubs, but no, he has to get me the woman repeller, the eyesore from the Liberace house of crap.
It's not that bad.
Oh, yeah, easy for you to say, you don't have to walk around sporting some reject from the Mr. T collection.

scene: Ross 和 Phoebe 在 Central Perk 观察 Rachel 与一个男人谈话
difficulty_description: 对话涉及多层次表达和一些文化背景的理解，特别适合高级学习者。

dialogues.text: Would you look at that guy, I mean how long has he been talking to her. It's like, back off buddy she's a waitress not a geisha.
I think she's OK.
[Rachel, laughing, puts a hand on the guy's shoulder] Look at that, look at that, see how she's pushing him away and he won't budge. Alright, I'm gonna do something.
[walks up in the middle of their conversation] Excuse me, are you Rachel?
What?
I'm Ross Geller. Wha, I'm, God in your ad you said you were pretty but wow.
What are you, what are you doin'?
Oh, oh my God, is this the wrong day? I don't believe it, uh, well, hey, I guess if it works out we'll, we'll have something to tell the grandkids.
Sure will. I've uh, gotta go. Take care.
OK, see ya later, nice meeting you. [man leaves] You're welcome.
What?
I was saving you.
Saving, saving, saving me from the pleasant conversation with the interesting man, saving me?
Oh, see from where I was sitting I uh. . .
OK, Ross, listen to me, I am not yours to save.
But, you are.
What?
Uh, uh, well you're, umm, you're my lobster.
OK, you know what, are, are you being like, the blind date guy again?

No no, you're uh, you're my lobster. See um, lobsters, uhh, in the tank when, when they're old, uhh, they get with, uhh, they walk around holding the claws. In the tank, ya know, with, with the holding and. . . Uhh, Phoebs you wanna help me out with the, the whole lobster thing?
Do the claws again.
Rach. OK, forget, forget the lobsters OK. We're, let's talk, what about us?
Ross, there is no us, OK.
No, but. . .
No, listen to me. I fell for you and I get clobbered. You then fall for me and I again, somehow, get clobbered. I'm tired of being clobbered, ya know, it's, it's just not worth it.
Well, but, but. . .
NO but Ross. We are never gonna happen, OK. Accept that.
E-except, except that what?
No, no, ACC-cept that.
Oh.

scene: Chandler 和 Joey 在他们的公寓里和解
difficulty_description: 对话涉及一些复杂的情感表达和幽默感，适合有一定英语基础的学习者。
